content.description: Hard-ish moves on bad rock up just right of Kettle Corn. The first bolt is sorta hard to clip, but you can boulder past it and clip after you are above it on good solid holds. Continue up the face past 6 bolts to Mussy Hooks.
content.location: The broken and dark features just right of the crack that is Kettle Corn

content.description:
Best of the crappy rock routes on this crag. Thin-ish face moves on slabby kitty litter lead to some nice brown rock. 6 bolts to Mussy Hooks. Anchor at top is sort of a rope shredder if you are getting lowered due to a sharp plate just below the Mussy Hooks.

Susan's Notes: Route is farthest right on the crag just before an extremely exfoliating corridor. First two bolts are up some thin entry moves entwined with orange lichen.
content.protection: 6 bolts to Mussy Hooks.  Highly Recommended to extend from anchors for TR.
content.location: Far right side of the crag.  Start in the white rock and head up and left following the bolts.

content.description:
Somewhat contrived even though it is a crack line. Stay off 200 Proof that is two feet to your left as you climb the crack. After about 10 feet it eases considerably.

Susan's Notes: Bring some .5"-2.5" gear. This route has it's own anchors up and right of the crack. Or just top rope from the closed shut anchors to your left on 200 Proof should you choose.
content.protection: Medium sized pro, or top rope from neighborhing routes.
content.location: Obvious crack and left facing corner in the middle of the pillar.

content.description: Laughably bad rock gives a funky boulder problem start. Clip a few bolts where giant dinner-plates have been removed and move left crossing over towards Sparge past two more bolts (squeeze job) and shared anchors.
content.location: Start where the exfoliating cracks offer a grainy entry move to the face.

content.description: Takes a bold line up the worst rock on the crag. This one has a bail link on the second bolt. Start in the broken area and work your way up the buttress, keeping right of the exfoliating overlap to your left. Really crappy rock and 6 bolts to Mussy Hooks.
content.location:
Takes the left-hand buttress of the crag when looking at the north face.

Susan's note:  The route is basically east facing, your back would be towards Hillbilly Pillar.  Start slightly left of the arete.

content.description: Best route on the crag on surprisingly good rock. Take the best portion of rock up the middle of the face. 6 bolts to Mussy Hooks.
content.location:
Find the best rock on the face and you are on the route.

Susan's Note:  The route starts in a finger crack covering a varnished shield; route trends up and slightly left to anchor.  Ignore mystery closed-shut anchors on the middle top....they are for no particular reason or route we could identify.
